data.name: Quote Extractor
data.description:
In this kata, you will create a tool that can extract all quotes from a given string.
```
"'The best error message is the one that never shows up.' - Thomas Fuchs"
â‡’
{ "The best error message is the one that never shows up." }
```
You will receive single and double quotes, all of which are on the same line.
```
"'This' is valid" -> { "This" }
"This is also "valid"" -> { "valid" }
"So 'is' "this"" -> { "is", "this" }
```
If you recive anything that is nested, you should separate them if the quote character is the same, and include them in the first, outermost quotation if they are different. For example: 
```
Separate
--------
"'Hello 'World''" -> { "Hello ", "" }
  ^     ^     ^^
 'Hello '     ''
 
Include
--------
"Hello 'World'"   -> { "Hello 'World'" }
```

Some strings are also invalid, such as those containing mismatching `"` and `'`, or those that don't match anything at all. However, you should look closely before labeling something as wrong. The first example from above, for instance, could be misleading at first.

True invalid inputs, however, should return an empty array.
```
"'Dang, only one quote!" -> { }
"'Mismatch..."" -> { }
```
Lastly, if other quotes in the string are valid, those still need to be collected. That rule might be the most annoying part of this challenge. :p
```
""""'hello'" -> { "", "hello"}
   ^-- The `"` here is ignored.
```

Let me know if I missed anything, but that should be it.
